pull_request.title: Update inertial values when links are scaled in model editor

update.description:
* update mass and inertia when user scales a link using the scale tool in model editor.  The calculation of the new inertia is dependent on the collision shape and it assumes uniform density. If the link has more than one collision, a box inertia is used instead.

* inertia scaling: 

    1. solves box, cylinder, and sphere inertia equations to find inertia size/radius/length (see msgs.cc: [AddBoxLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2142), [AddCylinderLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2172), and [AddSphereLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2200)

    1. applies scale to inertia size/radius/length

    1. calculates new inertia matrix based on new size/radius/length

* convert `ModelData` class to to ign math

* added test

* update mass and inertia when user scales a link using the scale tool in model editor.  The calculation of the new inertia is dependent on the collision shape and it assumes uniform density. If the link has more than one collision, a box inertia is used instead.

* inertia scaling: 

    1. solves box, cylinder, and sphere inertia equations to find inertia size/radius/length (see msgs.cc: [AddBoxLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2142), [AddCylinderLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2172), and [AddSphereLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2200)

    1. applies scale to inertia size/radius/length

    1. calculates new inertia matrix based on new size/radius/length

* convert `ModelData` class to to ign math

* added test
update.title: Update inertial values when links are scaled in model editor

pull_request.title: Update inertial values when links are scaled in model editor

pullrequest.title: Update inertial values when links are scaled in model editor

content.raw:
I created a "lead ball" as follows:

1. Insert a sphere in the model editor

1. Change the radius of visual and collision to 1 m to make calculation easier

1. On the inspector, put 47476.8 kg for mass (11340 kg/m3 * 4 / 3 * PI * 1^3)

1. For inertia, put 18990.72 kg . m2 for ixx, iyy and izz (2 / 5 * 1^2 * 47476.8)

1. Save it and on the simulation, turn on CoM visualization - the CoM visual should match the visual and collision sizes.

Now edit it, scale it and save. I'd expect the CoM visual for the scaled sphere to also match its size but it doesn't. The CoM is always visibly bigger, whether the sphere was scaled up or down. It could be a problem with the CoM visual or with the scaling.

As a reference, I scaled the lead sphere to about 2 m radius, so I'd expect the mass to become about 379814.4 kg (11340 kg/m3 * 4 / 3 * PI * 2^3), but it became 3049075.158474 kg, which is one order of magnitude above.
content.html:
I created a "lead ball" as follows:

  1. Insert a sphere in the model editor

  2. Change the radius of visual and collision to 1 m to make calculation easier

  3. On the inspector, put 47476.8 kg for mass (11340 kg/m3 * 4 / 3 * PI * 1^3)

  4. For inertia, put 18990.72 kg . m2 for ixx, iyy and izz (2 / 5 * 1^2 * 47476.8)

  5. Save it and on the simulation, turn on CoM visualization - the CoM visual should match the visual and collision sizes.

Now edit it, scale it and save. I'd expect the CoM visual for the scaled sphere to also match its size but it doesn't. The CoM is always visibly bigger, whether the sphere was scaled up or down. It could be a problem with the CoM visual or with the scaling.

As a reference, I scaled the lead sphere to about 2 m radius, so I'd expect the mass to become about 379814.4 kg (11340 kg/m3 * 4 / 3 * PI * 2^3), but it became 3049075.158474 kg, which is one order of magnitude above.

content.raw: If I flatten a box or cylinder close to a very thin value and then stretch it back to the original size, its inertia values are quite different from the original values. Maybe there's a loss of precision somewhere?
content.html: If I flatten a box or cylinder close to a very thin value and then stretch it back to the original size, its inertia values are quite different from the original values. Maybe there's a loss of precision somewhere?

content.raw: That's a tricky one. What if the user does want to change only the mass but keep the inertia? Maybe we can have a checkbox for "auto-calculate inertia"?
content.html: That's a tricky one. What if the user does want to change only the mass but keep the inertia? Maybe we can have a checkbox for "auto-calculate inertia"?

pull_request.title: Update inertial values when links are scaled in model editor

update.description:
* update mass and inertia when user scales a link using the scale tool in model editor.  The calculation of the new inertia is dependent on the collision shape and it assumes uniform density. If the link has more than one collision, a box inertia is used instead.

* inertia scaling: 

    1. solves box, cylinder, and sphere inertia equations to find inertia size/radius/length (see msgs.cc: [AddBoxLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2142), [AddCylinderLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2172), and [AddSphereLink](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/67f7bfaa17951d5dde04891949f4022c97204d44/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc?at=default#msgs.cc-2200)

    1. applies scale to inertia size/radius/length

    1. calculates new inertia matrix based on new size/radius/length

* convert `ModelData` class to to ign math

* added test
